intro: Crepis balcanica, commonly known as the Balkan mouse-ear, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the Balkan Peninsula and thrives in rocky and calcareous soils. The plant is characterized by its small, basal rosette of silver-gray leaves and slender flowering stems. Its flowers are typically yellow or pale green, arranged in a single head. Crepis balcanica is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
